name: Unseen Sunscreen Invisible Broad Spectrum SPF 40 PA +++
about: What it is:u00a0The original 100% invisible, weightless, scentless sunscreen that delivers broad spectrum SPF protection & doubles as a primer with a natural finish...Skin Type:u00a0Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily..Skincare Concerns:u00a0Fine Lines and Wrinkles, Pores, and Dullness and Uneven Texture..Formulation:u00a0Gel..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Complex Derived from Meadowfoam Seed: Increases hydration levels, resulting in a more even skin texture..- Red Algae: Helps protect against blue light emitted by electronic devices..- Frankincense: Provides a soothing effect...Ingredient Callouts:u00a0This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and gluten-free...What Else You Need to Know:u00a0 This iconic bestseller was created to eliminate any reason you have to not wear SPF u2014 it doesn't smell like sunscreen, it doesn't leave a white cast (ever!), it doesn't feel heavy or greasy & it's free of pore-clogging oils. Plus, it doubles as a makeup-gripping primer.
ingredients: -Complex Derived from Meadowfoam Seed: Increases hydration levels, resulting in a more even skin texture.               .-Red Algae: Helps protect against blue light emitted by electronic devices..-Frankincense: Provides a soothing effect...Avobenzone, 3%, Homosalate 8%, Octisalate 5%, Octocrylene 4%, Isododecane, Dimethicone Crosspolymer, Dimethicone/Bis-Isobutyl PPG-20 Crosspolymer, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Isohexadecane, Dicaprylyl Carbonate, Meadowfoam Estolide, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Polyester-7, Neopentyl Glycol Diheptanoate, Lithothamnion Calcareum Extract, Caprylyl Glycol, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Jojoba Esters, Mannitol, Olibanum, Lecithin, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Diatomaceous Earth, Zinc Sulfate, Silica, Tocopherol.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply generously and evenly as the last step in your skincare routine, before makeup and 15 minutes before sun exposure..-Reapply at least every two hours or after 40 minutes of swimming or sweating.

reviews.review_text: Supergoop is my go-to sunscreen. The formula and texture is very lightweight and does leave a whitecast. It works great on my sensitive skin and makes my face feel smooth and not greasy at all. I have the sample size in my purse all the time. Best sunscreen I have ever had.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: As someone that has rosacea, I need to be careful about the products I use on my face, so I've been using the same sunscreen for years (Shiseido Urban Environment sunscreen). It comes at a pretty high price point so I wanted to see if there was something else I could use that's a little more affordable, since sun is one of my biggest triggers.   The consistency of this product is very different than most sunscreens and feels more like a primer. It spreads VERY easily and the normal 1/4 tsp that I use for my face, covered both my neck and chest as well. My makeup sat well on top and I liked that it was odourless.   The consistency is still weird to me, but I'll keep using it for now since it seems like my skin tolerates it well, it's more cost effective and fragrance free, which are all wins for me!

reviews.review_title: Immediately A STAPLE Part of My Routiune
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've got very oily skin, expecially in summer. And a lot of suncreens have broken me out, or have piled under my makeup. I've tried many many sunscreens, both drugstore and high end, and the only one that came close to this was Khiel's gel sunscreen (linked below), but it's got a very high price point. I've tried the Supergoop play sunscreen and really enjoy it for my chest (which is also super sensitive and acne prone) - so I thought I'd take a stab at the Unseen Sunscreen, and I absolutely love it. The texture at first does feel a little thick, but it seamlessly blends into your skin and feels super lightweight once it's settled. The best aprt of this sunscreen for me is that my makeup look absolutely amazing over it - it doesn't feel like I've got sunscreen on, and it doesn't look like I've got additional layers underneath. I actually think this acts as a better primer than the Olehenrikson Banana Bright Primer (which I typically use on glam nights out).   Highly highly recommend giving this sunscreen a shot, I will definitely keep purchasing & this will most likely be replacing a lot of my other base products.   https://buy.cosmeticsnow.ca/iteminfo/kiehls-ultra-light-daily-uv-defense-spf50-60ml?ad_type=pla&target_id=1871050644393&ad_id=&utm_source=googleads&vt_keyword=&vt_campaign=21373082869&vt_adgroup=&vt_loc_interest=&vt_physical=9061030&vt_matchtype=&vt_network=x&vt_placement=&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=21373082869&gad_source=4&gbraid=0AAAAADhZK-xIRbVbKPOyA_zsIlF6ygPWI

reviews.review_title: This sunscreen does not pill on my skin!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Porcelain skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Okay so I'll start by saying that I've tried many sunscreens. Sprays, creams, gels all pill on my skin and usually make me look shiny (in a greasy way which makes me not want to wear them because my acne looks worse). I know that some people say that if sunscreen is pilling it is usually the order you apply your skincare on before, after, letting things dry, rubbing it in, tapping it in, etc. I have tried different ways of applying other sunscreens, sometimes one method helps but it still will start to pill the moment I perspirate.   I live in Canada so it's not usually super sunny through lots of the year but I do have very light skin and easily burn when it does get warmer. I'd heard good things about this brand before on social media but was unsure because of the price being so high for such a small quantity and not even knowing if I like it. Finally decided to give in and buy it though and even though it's expensive and this sunscreen is not shiny at all, completely clear so no white cast, applied without pilling and literally didn't even need time to set in.   Will definitely repurchase this once it runs out (even though it's expensive it's certainly cheaper than buying ones I'm not happy with) and will likely use my other brand ones as reapplies for my hands after washing or something just to not waste them. Exceeded my expectations and won't be buying any other face sunscreen. :))

reviews.review_text: This is a great product. It is very pricy however I've been looking for a face SPF that I like for years and haven't been able to find one until now, and skin protection/cancer prevention is super important to me so the price point is worth it if it's going to get me to wear it every day. It doesn't make my face feel sticky or greasy and it sits really nicely under makeup. It does feel a bit silicon-y but once it sinks into your skin you can no longer feel it so that doesn't bother me. It also doesn't have any scent at all which I like.

reviews.review_title: I wish it didn't sting my eyes
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I'm conflicted with this product. I like it because it doesn't leave my face as oily as other sunscreens, does not leave a white cast - completely UNSEEN!, and there is no oil in the short list of ingredients. However, it stings my eyes after a few hours. Also, because the lotion is totally invisible, while applying it on my face I couldn't tell if I already applied it on some spots/areas of my face, which might have caused me to apply twice or more on some areas. Does anyone has the same experience?  Nevertheless, if it didn't sting my eyes, I would have continued on using it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried so many different sunscreens and I almost always have the same complaint: they leave my skin feeling oily. For background, I have naturally oily skin so I tend to prefer products with a mattifying finish. This product is just that. It applies beautifully and leaves a dry, matte finish. I use this product under my go to daily moisturizer and it's the perfect combination for me. If your skin is on the dryer side, I can see how this might not be the product for you. But for anyone with oily skin, this is the best moisturizer I have found (so far!)

Our photographer did a lot of flash photography in the evening and there was no sign of this under my makeup. I have since repurchased and wear it everyday.
